bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, April 12, 1919

div1.p: Blue sends Carter to New Orleans and other southern states to investigate malaria.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, April 12, 1919
div1.opener:
E.E.M.
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
April 12, 1919.
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Public Health Service,
U. S. Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Maryland.
Sir:
div1.p:
Bureau telegram of April 10, 1919, as follows
is hereby confirmed:

“Proceed New Orleans and other places
necessary supervise malaria investiga-
tions.”

You are authorized to proceed to such places
as may be necessary to adequately supervise the malaria
investigations being conducted by the Service, particularly
in the Southern states. Your status while on this detail
will be that of special temporary duty.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Rupert Blue
Surgeon General. Jrs Jc
The expenses incurred in carrying out the fore-
going instructions are hereby authorized.
JS Hoyle
Assistant Secretary.
RB
